response.explain: The robot tried to approach the brisket directly, which is causing an error because the brisket is inside the fridge, not directly approachable. So, the robot first needs to approach the fridge instead of the brisket. After approaching the fridge, the robot must open it to access the brisket. So, unless the fridge is open the required subtask of moving the robot close to brisket cannot be performed.
response.subtask:
(1) Move the robot close to the fridge.
(2) Open the fridge.
(3) Take out the brisket.
(4) Move the robot to the front of the oven.
(5) Open the oven.
(6) Put the brisket inside the oven.
(7) Close the oven.
(8) Cook the brisket.
(9) Open the oven.
(10) Take out the brisket.
(11) Move the robot back to its original position.
response.code:
def act(robot,env,camera):
    # Subtask 1: Move robot close to the fridge
    fridge = registry(env, "fridge_dszchb_0")
    MoveBot(env, robot, fridge, camera)
    donothing(env)
